name: phoenix
description: The text editor designed to make coding as simple and fun as playing a video game
readme_summary: Phoenix is a modern, open-source text editor designed for web development, emphasizing a game-like user experience to make coding more enjoyable. It supports Brackets extensions, offers a seamless local development environment, and is built to be lightweight and easily auditable. The editor prioritizes simplicity and ease of development, aiming to provide a fast and efficient coding experience.
primary_use_case: Web development with a focus on JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, providing a lightweight and fun coding experience.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled architect meticulously designing a modern text editor building with glowing code bricks. The architect uses blueprints filled with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript symbols. The building features large, interactive screens displaying live previews of web pages. Digital particles flow around the architect, representing the ease and fun of coding. The scene is set in a bright, open studio with a futuristic design. Small UI elements and code snippets are subtly incorporated into the scene. The composition is clean and focused with a vibrant color scheme. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.

name: winhider
description: winhider  - Hide windows from screensharing and also from taskbar / taskswitcher (Alt-Tab) while still being able to use them normally
readme_summary: WinHider is a C++ application that allows users to selectively hide windows from screensharing applications and the taskbar/taskswitcher. It provides both a GUI and CLI interface for managing window visibility, utilizing DLL injection to achieve its functionality.
key_features: Hides windows from taskbar and taskswitcher (Alt-Tab)
primary_use_case: Hiding specific application windows from being visible during screen sharing sessions and from the taskbar/taskswitcher, while still allowing the user to interact with them.
cover_image_prompt: A stage magician skillfully concealing a window (like a browser or application window) behind a shimmering curtain, while the rest of the stage is brightly lit and visible. The magician gestures with one hand, subtly manipulating the window's visibility. The audience sees the stage clearly, but the hidden window is only visible to the magician. Small UI elements float around the magician, showing the WinHider logo and controls. The scene is set in a modern theater with a spotlight on the magician. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and a touch of magic.

name: Addon
description: ClearURLs is an add-on based on the new WebExtensions technology and will automatically remove tracking elements from URLs to help protect your privacy.
readme_summary: ClearURLs is a browser add-on that automatically removes tracking elements from URLs, enhancing user privacy. It supports multiple browsers and offers features like blocking ad domains, cleaning multiple URLs, and preventing various tracking methods. The add-on aims to provide a cleaner and more private browsing experience by eliminating unnecessary tracking parameters from web addresses.
key_features: Built-in tool to clean up multiple URLs at once
Adds context menu entry for copying clean links
Prevents tracking injection over history API
Prevents Google and Yandex from rewriting search results with tracking elements
primary_use_case: Automatically remove tracking elements from URLs to protect user privacy while browsing the internet.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a meticulous gardener tending to a lush garden. The gardener carefully snips away unwanted vines and weeds (representing tracking elements) from healthy plants (representing clean URLs) using specialized clippers. A small digital screen embedded in the clippers displays the 'ClearURLs' logo. The garden is bathed in soft, natural light, symbolizing clarity and privacy. Subtle UI elements float around the garden, showing cleaned URLs. The composition is clean and focused, with a vibrant color scheme. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with rich details.

name: MORT
description: MORT 번역기 프로젝트 - Real-time game translator with OCR
readme_summary: MORT is a real-time game translator that extracts dialog from the screen using OCR and provides translations via machine translation services or a database. It supports multiple OCR engines and translation providers, allowing users to customize the translation process. The program is designed to help users understand foreign language games by providing instant translations of in-game text.
key_features: OCR (TesseractOCR, Windows OCR, NHOcr, Easy OCR)
Machine translation (Naver Papago, Google Web, Google Sheet, ezTrans, DeepL)
primary_use_case: Real-time translation of game dialogs using OCR and machine translation or database lookups.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a skilled linguist sitting at a desk, illuminated by a soft glow, translating text that magically appears from a video game screen floating before them. The game screen displays vibrant characters and dialogue boxes. The linguist uses a combination of ancient dictionaries and a futuristic tablet displaying real-time translation options. The translated text elegantly flows from the tablet onto a separate screen, showcasing the final result. Subtle digital particles swirl around the scene, representing the OCR and translation processes. The repository name, 'MORT,' is subtly etched onto the linguist's desk. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and a warm, inviting color scheme.

name: tftp-np-light
readme_summary: TFTP-NP is a PXE boot server that allows users to boot operating systems and utilities over a network. It supports both BIOS and UEFI systems and offers features like DHCP Proxy Mode, HTTP file sharing, and customizable menus. The server is configured through a config file or a web interface.
key_features: HTTP file sharing via the 'files' directory
Configuration via config.ini or web interface
primary_use_case: Network booting of operating systems and utilities using PXE.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled network engineer, depicted as a conductor, orchestrating a symphony of computers booting up seamlessly across a vast network. The engineer stands before a large console displaying a simplified network topology, with each computer represented by a musical instrument. As the engineer adjusts settings on the console, represented by a stylized TFTP-NP interface, each instrument begins to play in perfect harmony, symbolizing successful PXE boot processes. Subtle digital particles flow between the console and the instruments, representing data packets being transferred. The scene is set in a futuristic control room with soft, ambient lighting. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and crisp details.

name: frp
description: A fast reverse proxy to help you expose a local server behind a NAT or firewall to the internet.
readme_summary: frp is a fast reverse proxy that enables users to expose local servers, even those behind NAT or firewalls, to the internet. It supports various protocols like TCP, UDP, HTTP, and HTTPS, and offers features such as P2P connectivity, encryption, compression, and monitoring. frp simplifies the process of accessing internal services from external networks.
primary_use_case: Exposing local servers behind NAT or firewalls to the internet.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a skilled postal worker sorting packages at a bustling distribution center. The worker stands before a complex network of conveyor belts, representing the internet. Some packages originate from behind a large, imposing wall, symbolizing a NAT or firewall. The worker expertly redirects these packages to their correct destinations outside the wall, ensuring seamless delivery. Small screens display server addresses and port numbers, subtly connecting the metaphor to reverse proxy technology. The scene is set in a brightly lit, modern facility with a clean and efficient design. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with clear details and vibrant colors.

name: jumpserver
description: JumpServer is an open-source Privileged Access Management (PAM) tool that provides DevOps and IT teams with on-demand and secure access to SSH, RDP, Kubernetes, Database and RemoteApp endpoints through a web browser.
readme_summary: JumpServer is an open-source Privileged Access Management (PAM) tool designed to provide DevOps and IT teams with secure, on-demand access to SSH, RDP, Kubernetes, Database, and RemoteApp endpoints. It acts as a bastion host, centralizing and securing access through a web browser, enhancing security and simplifying access management.
key_features: Secure access to SSH, RDP, Kubernetes, Database, and RemoteApp endpoints
primary_use_case: Providing DevOps and IT teams with on-demand and secure access to various endpoints.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled gatekeeper stands before a heavily fortified digital gate, meticulously inspecting access requests represented as glowing keys. Each key attempts to unlock the gate, with the gatekeeper analyzing the key's permissions and security protocols displayed on holographic screens. Approved keys emit a green light as they grant access, while unauthorized keys trigger alarms and are rejected. The scene is set in a futuristic control center with a blue and purple color scheme, emphasizing security and control. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with crisp details and a focus on clarity.

name: shell-secrets
readme_summary: The shell-secrets repository provides a tool for managing environment variables by encrypting them with GPG. It allows users to securely store sensitive information in encrypted files and then easily load them into the environment using a simple login/logout mechanism. This helps prevent storing secrets in plain text shell files.
key_features: Reads secret values from encrypted files.
Provides a login function to set environment variables.
Includes a logout function to unset environment variables.
Updates the SECRET_LOGIN environment variable for shell prompt customization.
Offers autocomplete for available secret files.
primary_use_case: Securely managing and accessing sensitive environment variables in shell scripts.
cover_image_prompt: A locksmith carefully placing encrypted keys into a series of glowing, interconnected lockboxes representing environment variables. Each lockbox opens to reveal a small screen displaying sensitive data. The locksmith is dressed in modern attire, working in a futuristic vault filled with digital particles and subtle code snippets projected onto the walls. The repository name, 'shell-secrets,' is subtly etched into the vault door. The scene is lit with a cool, secure ambiance. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with clean lines and vibrant colors.
